hook.text: Once a month, a single egg bursts from the ovary and begins a brief journey that could create life.

buildup.text: A surge of luteinizing hormone triggers the dominant follicle to release its mature egg.

discovery.text: The released egg survives only 12 to 24 hours. If sperm don't reach it in time, it dissolves.

twist.text: Some women feel ovulation as a mild pain called mittelschmerz, German for middle pain.

climax.text: Ovulation is the shortest window in the cycle, yet it determines whether conception can occur.

punchline.text: One egg, one day, one chance each month.

quiz.question: How long does a released egg survive?
